edu.udel.cis.taschd.time

Class WeeklySchedule

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.udel.cis.taschd.time.WeeklySchedule

  • public class WeeklySchedule
extends java.lang.Object

    An ordered sequence of TimeIntervals, representing the weekly-recurring times at which some recurring event happens. Examples include the meetings times of a class, or the times at which a student is busy.

    WeeklySchedule is a ordered ArrayList of TimeIntervals.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description

      Constructs new empty WeeklySchedule.
      WeeklySchedule(java.util.Collection<TimeInterval> intervals)
      Constructs a new schedule from the given collection of TimeIntervals.

    • Constructor Detail

      • WeeklySchedule

        public WeeklySchedule()
        Constructs new empty WeeklySchedule.

      • WeeklySchedule

        public WeeklySchedule(java.util.Collection<TimeInterval> intervals)
        Constructs a new schedule from the given collection of TimeIntervals. The new WeeklySchedule will not keep any reference to the given Collection, hence subsequent modifications to the collection will not affect the new schedule. The new schedule may keep references to the member intervals of the collection, but since TimeIntervals are immutable, this fact should be invisible to the client. The internal representation may differ from the organization of the collection, in that intervals will be ordered and duplicates removed. The given Collection will not be modified.
        Parameters:
        intervals - any Collection of non-null TimeIntervals that will be used to build the new schedule.

    • Method Detail

      • getSchedule

        public java.lang.Iterable<TimeInterval> getSchedule()
        A getter to get the schedule as an iterable set of TimeIntervals.
        Returns:
        the schedule which is a WeeklySchedule.

      • addInterval

        public void addInterval(TimeInterval ti)
        Adds a TimeInterval to this schedule. If the given TimeInterval is already in this schedule, this is a no-op.
        Parameters:
        ti - a non-null TimeInterval to add to this schedule.

      • wtpsScore

        public double wtpsScore(WeeklySchedule that)
        This method returns the combined score, based on the time difference between an end point in one schedule and a start point in the other schedule, which is used as partial input arguments of Hungarian algorithm in edu.udel.cis.taschd.gen.Generator to get the optimum assignment.
        Parameters:
        that - a non-null WeeklySchedule that will be used to compute the score.
        Returns:
        a double value for computed score.

      • toStringOld

        public java.lang.String toStringOld()
        Constructs a short human-readable representation of this time interval, as a comma separated list, e.g., 
         "MONDAY 11:00–12:15, TUESDAY 11:00–12:15".
        Returns:
        a String representation of the schedule.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Constructs a short human-readable representation of this time interval, as a comma and semicolon-separated list, e.g., 
         Tue 11:00–12:15, 12:20–13:25; Thu 12:20–13:25
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        string representation of the schedule
